message: Let's end this quickly.  A 90/10 split seems fair to me given the inflation disadvantage you face.
Let's be fair.  A 50/50 split seems like the most equitable way to divide the money, considering the inflation we'll both face in the next round.

I appreciate the sentiment of a 50/50 split, but the inflation puts you at a bigger disadvantage with each round.  I'll take a little less than last time, and you'll still get a good chunk before it devalues further.

I understand the inflation is a big factor, but I believe a 40/60 split is a fairer compromise.  It allows you to get a good amount, while giving me a chance to recover some of my losses before the money becomes even less valuable.
Bob, we're running out of time.  This offer lets you walk away with more than you'd get if you reject and I have to make the final offer.
